text:
here an example: it works, however I would prefer not having to use JSON as intermediary
```bucket = Mongoc.Bucket(database)
io = Mongoc.open_upload_stream(bucket, "xxxxx")
write(io, JSON.json([1,2]))
close(io)

Mongoc.open_download_stream(bucket, "xxxxx") do io
    tmp_str = read(io, String)
    value = JSON.parse(tmp_str)
end```

elements.text: here an example: it works, however I would prefer not having to use JSON as intermediary

bucket = Mongoc.Bucket(database)
io = Mongoc.open_upload_stream(bucket, "xxxxx")
write(io, JSON.json([1,2]))
close(io)

Mongoc.open_download_stream(bucket, "xxxxx") do io
    tmp_str = read(io, String)
    value = JSON.parse(tmp_str)
end

text: The JSON3.jl package allows for "typed array" parsing. It returns a custom object (`JSON3.Array`), but if the data is homogenous, then it will be `JSON3.Array{Float64}` (for example)
